android.gameengine.icadroids.input

Class OnScreenButtons

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.gameengine.icadroids.input.OnScreenButtons

  • public class OnScreenButtons
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides statics and a few function to easily make use of the touch functionality of an android device. This class manages and draws virtual buttons to the screen to detect for input. When a button is enabled (by default) the user can check wether a button is pressed or not, by accessing the static boolean values for each correspodending button. Do not make an instance of this class yourself.
    Author:
    Roel

      • detectDpadHit

        private void detectDpadHit(float x,
                 float y)
        detects which side of a dpad has been pressed, or possibly more sides.
        Parameters:
        x - incoming x location of the press or move action
        y - incoming y location of the press or move action

      • onTouch

        public boolean onTouch(View v,
              MotionEvent event)
        used by the touchListener, do not call this function yourself!!! this checks for touch events from the device and it should call the appropriate function.
